translated: Bodhisattva-caryavatara, Fascicle 2
Collected Verses by Arya Nagarjuna
In the dense forest of Jalandhara, Central India
Practicing all wholesome deeds, with giving and morality leading the way,
Making offerings to the Tathagata, inexhaustible for a hundred thousand eons.
Cultivating patience, not establishing anger and wrongdoing,
Contemplating the emptiness of various natures, therefore patiently enduring with a single mind.
Not obtaining pleasant happiness, guarding the mind and keeping it balanced,
The mind has the illness of anger, without sleep always insufficient.
Here and there there are benefactors, providing for and supporting,
Following their loving and respectful minds, do not give rise to anger and distress.
In all matters of intimacy, do not give rise to dislike and aversion,
Do not be angry with them, and only then will you attain peace and happiness.
Patiently enduring such matters, if facing an enemy,
If one can eliminate anger, one will attain peace and happiness in every life.
If resentment arises in the mind, there is no joy even in love.
If one consumes the food of anger, no good without patience will be destroyed.
That food is my great enemy, and it brings me no benefit.
Knowing that enemy is not eaten, therefore patience is firm.
Whenever seeing an enemy come or go, rejoice and do not be angry.
If one gives rise to anger towards an enemy, all good benefits will be completely destroyed.
Always have a mind of patience like this, and do not allow anger to arise.
Dwelling in patience without time, anger and enemies will naturally not arise.
If a person protects themselves and does not engage in evil speech,
If one does not avoid evil speech, later one will experience the suffering of enemies.
Fearing suffering but not escaping it, not engaging in the causes of various sufferings,
Therefore, with a firm mind of patience, one attains all kinds of happiness.
The Nirgrantha Jains, with their wrong views seeking liberation,
Cut themselves with knives and burn themselves in fires, all for nothing, because they are able to endure pain.
Foolish and lacking right views, they suffer great hardships in vain.
How can I, with the mind of enlightenment, not endure suffering?
Mosquitoes, lice, bedbugs, and so on, are constantly afflicted by hunger and thirst,
And people who are greatly itchy and troubled endure it without seeing [the truth].
Cold, heat, rain, wind, illness, chains, beatings,
And all sorts of painful things - they endure it without seeking happiness.
When others are killed and blood flows, they are firm and brave,
But when their own bodies are cut and they see blood, they are terrified and fall down.
The wise ones' minds are pure, always fearing the invasion of anger and vexation,
Engaging in a struggle with afflictions, their minds of endurance are always courageous.
Snakes crawl on the ground, an analogy for anger subdued in the mind,
Killing is called cowardice, while killing him brings the greatest victory.
The greatly compassionate TathÄgata, out of pity for suffering, speaks of cyclic existence,
Causing one to recognize the root of offenses, to abide in patience, and not to commit them.
What do parents think? They fear their child will encounter drowning.
Holding the mind, being free from anger, one naturally distances oneself from great suffering.
It is like an unwise person, causing offenses to arise.
Cultivating practice while lacking wisdom, anger arises in the same way.
If one wishes to abide in the inconceivable, one must hold one's own mind.
Give rise to love and respect for this, causing anger not to arise.
If one craves for sense objects, various offenses will arise.
Due to the power of those karmic actions, one is unable to be free.
If one does not crave for sense objects, their accumulation has no basis.
Because the mind of union is absent, therefore there is no arising.
Not being greedy and not being born, without attainment and speaking for oneself,
Because I attain this, therefore birth is inconceivable.
They are neither born nor unborn, how can this attainment exist?
Observing this and that, extinguishing and attaining without remainder.
This mind is always pure, like a mani that follows colors,
All transformations arise from causes, how can there be a cause-less appearance?
When practicing in the past, what did those practices do?
Following the causes of those practices, equal causes give rise to effects.
Although everything is due to causes, good and evil causes are due to the mind,
Speaking of seeking quiescence, what fault is there in this?
If one grasps a cause that is a combination, this pleasure is in suffering and distress,
This mind cannot abide, the wise should encourage themselves.
Therefore, seeing an enemy, think of them as a good friend,
Because of engaging in such actions, one will obtain happiness.
Thus, all sentient beings are not free due to their karma.
If one attains freedom, who would willingly go towards suffering?
The distracted mind grasps at sense objects, the mind is pierced without awareness,
Eating stops eating, anger increases, and one returns to love in suffering.
If one lacks meritorious actions oneself, one returns to love and binds oneself with karma,
Like eating poisonous food, one falls into the abyss of birth and death.
If one dwells in afflictions oneself, it is truly due to not protecting oneself.
If one wishes to liberate others, how can this be achieved?
Afflictions confuse and muddy, leading to self-harm,
With intense poison and no compassion, why be angry and not protect?
If one's nature is already foolish and confused, and one acts chaotically towards others,
Giving rise to anger towards them is without doubt, like fire that can burn.
Sentient beings are foolish by nature, and their faults in conduct,
Are due to delusion and confusion, like smoke obscuring the sky.
If a person is angry and does not protect, it is due to delusion and ignorance,
Like holding a stick to encourage others, which only increases their anger and distress.
In my past lives, I caused suffering to sentient beings,
Therefore, in this present body, I am able to endure suffering and distress.
My body is like iron, undergoing burning and forging,
If the body is held like iron, how can there be suffering?
I now regard this body, as if it were a lifeless form,
Although it is subjected to various sufferings and distress, anger arises nowhere.
Foolish people create karma out of love, not knowing its root of suffering,
Obtaining suffering as a condition of their own faults, how can they give rise to anger and distress?
Like experiencing the suffering of hell, with flying birds and sword-forests,
Knowing that it arises from one's own karma, where can there be anger and resentment?
I obtain such karma, knowing the source of this fault,
Even if I enter hell, it is not caused by others.
Desiring to exhaust my karma, immeasurable and boundless,
Since my karma is like this, I will long endure in hell.
My faults are like this, they are truly my enemies,
How can I discern and know, foolishly deluded and resentful?
If a person self-protects and endures without resentment towards enemies,
The merit of this mind arises, how can one enter hell?
Exhausting my practice, obtaining the causes as they were then,
Without endurance, resentment, and lack of protection, destroying the practice.
The mind is formless and shapeless, scattered and then destroyed,
Because of protecting the body, one should endure bodily suffering.
As for verbal evil karma, I do not commit any faults,
Since my body is not afflicted by various sufferings, why would my mind have anger?
In this life, with a pure mind, I practice beneficial conduct,
Since there is no benefit, why bother with food and drink?
Whatever actions are done, the important thing is to benefit others,
If there is no benefit, it is not loved, and one will definitely incur blame without doubt.
It is better to die now, without greed for an evil life,
Although one may live a long time with an evil livelihood, upon death one will fall into a miserable realm.
It is like in a dream, experiencing a hundred years of joyful happiness,
Just like truly obtaining joy, upon awakening one knows it was temporary.
It is like that for impermanence, the length or brevity of life,
Having awakened to these two things, how can one obtain joy?
Staying in pleasure for a long time, considering oneself to have gained much benefit,
Like a practitioner who is robbed, naked and empty-handed.ğŸ”½Merit and blessings follow the decrease of offenses, and the roots of sin arise again.
When merit is exhausted and sin does not arise, one obtains the benefit of non-anger.
For what do they live their lives, only doing unwholesome things?
If one does not contemplate in this way, no wholesome [action] will not be destroyed.
One should not praise anger, because it destroys sentient beings.
In this way, benefiting others with the mind, anger has no chance to arise.
For the sake of those who cultivate the mind, in order to endure what is difficult to endure,
Seeing afflictions arise, this praises the merit of patience.
The wonderful Dharma, etc. of stupas and images, if slandered or destroyed,
The Buddha, etc. have no suffering or distress, and I do not become angry towards them.
Towards teachers and their retinue, do not do what is unloving,
Now, because of past lives, seeing this, one encourages oneself.
The enlightened mind observes sentient beings, always in various sufferings,
Having seen them thus, one is able to endure the sufferings.
Anger and ignorance, the faults are equal in discrimination,
In these poisonous faults, how can one speak of no faults?
How in the past did one create the karma of harming others?
Thus, the causes of these karmas, how can one stop them?
As the Buddha's blessings are also so, I now single-mindedly create,
With all sentient beings, with a compassionate mind looking at each other.
Like fire burning a house, the fire enters the house,
If there is grass in the house, the fire spreads on its own.
Thus, it is also a metaphor for the mind, uniting with the fire of anger,
Burning those meritorious virtues, in an instant there is nothing left.
If a person kills with their hands, releasing them is praiseworthy,
Who would not praise this goodness that can avert the sufferings of hell?
If a person in the world cannot endure a little suffering,
The sufferings of hell are immeasurable - why not end the causes of anger?
I have experienced such suffering in hundreds of thousands of hells,
Each time for the benefit of others, not for my own sake.
I have no such great suffering and distress,
Because I have left the world, I act for the benefit of others in this way.
Leaving suffering and attaining happiness, they all praise the merits,
Obtaining such praise, why not rejoice?
Since they have attained such unobstructed happiness,
The supreme practice of benefiting others, why don't the wise strive for it?
If one does not cultivate such supreme practice to attain happiness,
If one does not abandon this view, it will destroy right view.
If one respects and loves others, praising them with virtue,
Since others' virtues are praised, it is precisely self-respect and love.
One should give rise to the bodhi mind, for all sentient beings,
In order to enable them to attain all kinds of happiness, why be angry with sentient beings?
The Buddha is the offering of the three realms, wishing for sentient beings to attain Buddhahood,
Worldly benefits are not truly obtained, why create afflictions for them?
If a person's bones and flesh, as well as all relatives,
Are nurtured and regarded as life itself, why give rise to dislike and anger?
Just as they seek bodhi, they should use the bodhi mind,
But if they do not love sentient beings, blessings leave them by themselves, why be angry?
If a person has something they seek, giving out wealth is a great act of generosity,
If what is sought is not obtained, it is not as good as keeping the wealth at home.
Pure meritorious blessings, what obstacles prevent them from being obtained?
Having obtained it, one does not accept it oneself, like abiding in anger and practicing.
Creating offenses and creating blessings, not the same, not rejoicing,
Also not relying on creation, one should have nothing to obtain oneself,
If loving an enemy, wishing to seek their joy,
And again seeking praises, this matter has no cause to obtain,
Although wishing for perfect benefit, in return suffering without joy,
The mind of enlightenment is not patient, not accomplishing benefit,
The evil hook of afflictions, pulling people not in control,
Like the wardens of hell, throwing people into boiling water and fire,
I originally sought to benefit others, why need empty praises?
No blessings, no lifespan, no strength, no peace and joy.
Self-beneficial practices not complete, the wise should be aware,
Later and later practicing oneself, should love and enjoy the perfection.
If one praises practice, but holds a knife to commit suicide,
It is like worldly unreal things, without benefit or benefit and joy.
It is like a destroyed house, the sun shines and sees inside and out,
It is also due to non-praise, one must use the mind to understand clearly.
You contemplate the sound, arising and ceasing in equality,
The mind is like this benefiting others, one should practice like this.
What is received from others, and practices benefiting others,
Since they attain happiness, my benefit is not false.
Each and every one attains benefit and joy, praising me with everything,
Why is there no separate majestic virtue and joy in me?
They praise me like this, loving themselves and attaining,
They have no conditions like this, like a fool, like a confused person.
Although I attain this praise, it is quickly destroyed and should not be attached to,
Those who hate the true virtues, by this they give rise to anger.
This praise becomes an obstacle, I do not allow it to arise,
Protecting against falling into evil destinies, for them I practice selflessness.
If one understands that sentient beings are bound by the fetters of offerings and high status,
In order to liberate sentient beings, how could one give rise to anger towards them?
If a person wishes to abandon suffering and enter the gate of liberation,
This is the Buddha's majestic virtue, how could I be angry with them?
This anger I do not create, because it obstructs merit,
Practicing impartial forbearance, there is nothing they do not attain.
One's own faults and shortcomings, due to forbearance one does not create,
Because faults and shortcomings are not created, one attains that merit.
If a person has no merit, forbearance arises from oneself,
Always causing one to abide in forbearance, how can one speak of obstruction?
Seeking to benefit the world, one does not create obstacles for giving,
Because obstacles prevent leaving the home life, one does not leave the home life.
In the world, those difficult to obtain, one is able to give to those who seek,
I only speak of good benefits, in faults there is nothing to be obtained.
By that bodhisattva practice, one is far removed from enemies,
Like taking out treasures from the house, therefore it is said to be not difficult.
Repenting of karmic causes, they are the initial guide,
Therefore in the fruit of patience, it is born in this way.
That mind without possessiveness, this mind then abides in patience,
Accomplishing the inconceivable, making offerings to the wonderful Dharma.
This mind is for benefiting others, even to the extent of one's life,
Or with enemies not making offerings, how can patience be separately spoken of?
To those evil minds here and there, each and every one is given patience,
In attaining such forbearance, it is due to making offerings to the wonderful Dharma.
The Buddha-land and the sentient beings' land, the Great Sage speaks of this,
In serving many there, one can evoke wealth and nobility.
The TathÄgata and the Dharma are equal to sentient beings,
Because of respecting the Buddha, one also respects sentient beings.
Establishing the mind like this, there is nothing to do for oneself,
With that great equality, one is equal to sentient beings.
The great intention towards sentient beings, with a compassionate mind making offerings,
Giving rise to the mind like the Buddha's blessings, like the Buddha's blessings one can attain.
Therefore, in the practice of the Buddha's teachings, the Buddha and sentient beings are equal,
The Buddha has nothing to be equal to, the ocean of merits is boundless.
The Buddha's merits are pure, no merits can compare,
Although there are offerings in the three realms, seeing them one is unable to [attain enlightenment].
The teacher of the Buddha's teachings and so forth, is the most superior sentient being,
One should make offerings to all sentient beings, and think like this.
If one is unable to perform beneficial actions for one's own relatives,
What fault is there in not performing service for others?
If one destroys the body and enters AvÄ«ci Hell, if they have done it, I will do it again,
With a vast mind for all of them, one should always engage in wholesome actions like this.
It is like worldly people who are the masters, because their own affairs are not satisfactory,
How can they be the children of others? I am not of the nature of their servants.
It is like the Buddha entering suffering without suffering, like attaining happiness and being joyful again,
One must delight all those Buddhas, and being delighted by the Buddhas, one is able to do this for them.
Just as the body has afflictions everywhere, one wishes for all lacks to be completely fulfilled,
It is the same with the suffering of sentient beings, I have no skillful means, only empty compassion and pity.
Therefore, I now distance myself from this suffering, and arise with great compassion to save all suffering,
First, I repent of the offenses I have committed in tormenting those who practice patience.
I now serve the Tathagata, the same as the servants of the world,
If people step on my head with their feet, I will joyfully accept it as if it were the Buddha.
I am able to do all lowly jobs in the world, without obstruction due to compassion and pity,
Seeing this incomparable form, who would not respect such a venerable one?
In this way, I serve the Tathagata, in this way I accomplish my own benefit,
In this way, I now leave the household life in order to remove the suffering and distress of the world.
It is like a single royal person who is able to subdue the great assembly,
The multitude is not disciplined by one person, but by the long-lived king.
That one is not alone, but has the power of the king,
Controlling and cutting off without cowardice or inferiority, and also without fault.
The mind of compassion and pity abides in patience, with power like that of a hell warden,
Protecting sentient beings, as if serving an evil king.
Anger is not what the king commands, like the suffering in hell,
Afflictions towards sentient beings, that suffering is self-inflicted.
Joy is not what the king bestows, like attaining Buddhahood,
The good mind towards sentient beings, why not receive this mind?
Protecting sentient beings, one will later attain Buddhahood,
Seeing the respect and praise inspired, why not see this good?
Without illness and also upright and dignified, happy and long-lived,
Wealthy and noble, becoming a wheel-turning king, all of this is attained from patience.
The wise practice patience, and bodhisattvas abide in diligence.
Laziness is far from blessings, like being apart from the wind.
What is the meaning of the power of diligence?
That must be explained in detail. Laziness is not diligence, like poison one should observe oneself.
Craving the taste of sleep, considering it pleasant and carefree,
The suffering of samsara is to be despised, but it arises from laziness.
The abode of afflictions, laziness pulls one into it with force,
Having already reached the door of impermanence, why do you not know now?
Diligence is for oneself and others, but you do not see this practice.
Lazy and sleepy again, this is like an ox in a butcher's shop.
If you do not see this, all paths are cut off,
Since you have nothing to gain, why enjoy sleep?
If you attain dignified deportment, impermanence will suddenly arrive,
Generosity is unattainable, why dwell in laziness?
If one is diligent but does not practice, peacefully as if diligent,
Suddenly heading towards impermanence, contemplating and suffering suffering.
Seeing the gate of Yama, suffering and distress again,
Tears fall in an instant, relatives cannot save.
Hearing the sounds of hell, thinking of the heat of karma,
The body dwells in an impure place, frightened and unable to endure.
The suffering of hell is extremely evil, what evil karma to do again?
Like a fish alive in a cauldron, it gets such fear.
Having created the karma of hell, one then suffers the pain of boiling water,
The body rots and suffers, how to attain purity?
The demon king brings much suffering to people, catching people and sending them to impermanence,
Impermanence is fearful suffering, this is seen as the result of laziness.
Foolishly attached to sleep, this fault is not inferior,
Entering the great river of suffering, and again not obtaining a human body.
Removing the supreme Dharma of joy, the seed of boundless joy,
Laziness and playfulness, the cause of suffering, why do you enjoy it?
Seeing the power of anger in defeat, knowing that they themselves are diligent,
Each one's practice is the same as their own.
How can I attain enlightenment, acting without discrimination,
With the true reality of the TathÄgata, truly speaking, correct liberation.
Those mosquitoes, gnats, flies, and insects,
If they obtain the power of diligence, they will also attain enlightenment.
How can I, born as a human, know what is beneficial and not beneficial,
Always knowing all diligence, how can I not attain enlightenment?
Or giving up hands and feet, being afraid of this,
The foolish and deluded go against the teacher's teachings, not knowing this benefit for others.
Cutting, destroying, and burning, all without limit, they are pulled out,
For countless koá¹­is of kalpas, yet they have not attained enlightenment.
Having experienced these countless sufferings for a long time, they finally attain enlightenment,
Like being wounded by poisonous pain, when the poison is exhausted, all pain comes out.
Becoming all kinds of doctors, they cure the suffering of various illnesses,
Therefore, the suffering is eliminated, and all illnesses are few.
Therefore, it is said that in curing illnesses, sweet medicine is not beneficial,
The superior doctor treats serious illnesses, not giving sweet medicine at all.
Before and after, it is all like this, what the wise all practice,
Advancing in practice later and later, using one's body and flesh.
The wise observe the body and flesh, comparing them to vegetables that grow,
Withering and discarded in the filth, this giving is not considered difficult.
If the body does what is painful, the mind is said to be falsely acting,
The wise mind is not evil, they have no evil karma or suffering.
Knowing the Dharma, the mind is joyful, possessing blessings, the body is joyful,
Without this false cycle of rebirth, how can one attain suffering and compassion?
Seeking to end past offenses, deeply benefiting others, the ocean of blessings,
This power is the bodhicitta, the two vehicles and so forth are essential.
Such benefits are not enjoyed, practicing practice, how can one attain suffering?
The chariot of bodhicitta, the wise ride and attain joy.
For the sake of perfecting sentient beings, happily bestowing the power of skillful means,
The power of the body, the fear of suffering, observing it is only praise.
Cutting off such discrimination, increasing diligence,
My body is able to abandon, surpassing the skillful means of the body.
I eliminate the faults of self and others, countless,
If each and every fault were to end without remainder,
If each and every fault were to end, I would have not a trace,
Free from boundless suffering, why would my mind be harmed?
I seek many merits, for the benefit of self and others,
Learning each and every merit, even if eons end, learning is inexhaustible.
Not a trace of merit have I ever created,
Perhaps I will be reborn in a place where I waste my life with nothing.
I delight in making great offerings, making offerings to the World-Honored Buddha,
Being poor, I am unable to do so, and my vow is not fulfilled.
Not giving peace to the fearful, not cultivating the joy of a mother,
As if entering the mother's womb, the mother only suffers in sickness.
In the past, I was separated from the Dharma, and now I receive the karmic retribution,
Being born like this, what Dharma practice should I engage in?
All wholesome mental faculties, the sage of the world,
Those faculties are always not regressing, and one always obtains good karmic retribution.
Afflictions and suffering entangle one, and one encounters various fears,
One generates offenses and attracts difficulties due to attachment to others.
If a person is able to give rise to wholesome wishes everywhere,
And encounters those blessings, one obtains the fruits of offerings.
If a person commits offenses and seeks happiness everywhere,
And encounters those retributions, one obtains the invasion of suffering.
The moon's treasury is clear and cool, vast, wondrous, and pure,
The Buddha's voice and flavor are supreme, and cannot be attained without cultivation.ğŸ”½Then, the son of the Well-Gone One,
Obtains the well-gone Dharma,
Like a lotus emerging supreme, also like the moon of benevolence and awareness.
The Yama hell wardens drag and pull the sinful souls,
The pit of fire and molten copper, all enter to be burned and boiled.
Blazing flames and killing weapons, cutting flesh by the hundred thousand pounds,
Falling onto the hot iron ground, this is due to much unwholesomeness.
Therefore, the mind creates goodness, extremely subtle observation,
Relying on that vajra banner, cultivate and practice contemplation.
First, learning to contemplate the combination, not contemplating your non-learning,
But without the name of the highest, you must turn your mind to do it.
What is done in the midst of birth, increases sin and suffering,
Not cultivating the superior deeds, that inferior one does not seek victory.
The three kinds of things should be known, due to the power of karma and afflictions,
The evil causes of the future, how can they be created here?
The afflictions of the world, restraining people without freedom,
I am like a person who cannot, therefore I have nothing to do.
How can one cultivate the lower practices and abide in them?
One should contemplate the self and non-self, and what is done by this self.
A drop of nectar, a bird eats and transforms into a garuá¸a,
I think it is insignificant, able to escape a little suffering and difficulty.
Anger creates a difficult state of mind, due to unwholesome offenses,
Without a mind, one sees the arising of vast and excellent difficulties.
Therefore, with a pure mind, I composed this verse,
To let them know that in the three realms, I am far removed from idle speculation.
I have attained victory over all, no one can defeat me,
I now know for myself, I am the lion cub of the Buddha.
Sentient beings are free from self and person, and they attain the supreme,
Not subduing the enemy of laziness, the enemy of laziness is subdued by itself.
Dragged by the evil destinies, the good of the body is quickly destroyed,
Due to foolish and evil servants, I became emaciated from eating leftovers.
He accepted everything, practiced with pride,
And this fame was obtained. How can it be said to be inferior?
If one is thus courageous, One conquers one's own enemies,
Practicing courage in this way, Pride cannot conquer one's enemies.
If the mind of pride arises, This is truly my enemy.
Although one wishes to give rise to the superior fruits, All these fruits are abandoned.
Like a diligent lion, Seeing the beasts of afflictions,
Although there are millions of beasts of afflictions, They cannot withstand it.
In the world there is great suffering, People all see it for themselves,
If the afflictions are not subdued, One will obtain suffering like this.
I would rather have my head cut off, And my heart and intestines torn out,
I will not subdue any of the enemies of the afflictions.
Because of cultivating this diligence,ğŸ”½One can eliminate the karma of arrogance and attain the supreme reward,
Naturally experiencing joyful and playful bliss.
If one cultivates causes for happiness, one will not obtain them,
And what one cultivates will be uncertain and not outstanding.
Transmigrating in desire is insufficient, like craving honey on the edge of a sword,
If one craves the sweetness of blessings and nectar, it will become sweeter after eating.
Therefore, the karma of tranquility can bring about wonderful fruits and rewards in accordance with one's conduct,
Like the sun being warm and the moon being cold, following each other day and night.
The power of diligence can break through laziness,
And because one attains detachment, one deeply cherishes it in one's mind.
The solid club of afflictions fights against the sword of mindfulness and wisdom,
Like a club and sword held together, the same as a woman's training.
The hand holding the sword is powerless, losing it and becoming frightened in a hurry,
The same is true for losing the sword of mindfulness, as hell resides in the mind.
The world knows good people, yet they are unwilling to drink poisonous blood,
The faults of the mind are also like this, one should not commit the faults of the mind.
The mind of striving for renunciation is like holding a bowl of oil,
If the bowl falls, one will surely die, one is frightened by its falling.
Attachment to sleep and laziness is like a poisonous snake in the bosom,
If one does not remove it, one will be injured, one should quickly remove it.
Each and every deep fault, one must turn the mind and contemplate,
This fault cannot be guarded, how can I do it again?
The cause of karma that is combined, cut it with the sword of right mindfulness,
What is called one's own position, this thought is attained?
The mind of right mindfulness does not arise, even a tiny bit cannot be extinguished,
Future karma is like past actions, all retributions are obtained.
